Problem:
class AirConditioner { constructor(powerState, temperature) { this.isOn = powerState; this.temperature = temperature; }  setTemperature(newTemp) { if (this.isOn && newTemp >= 16 && newTemp <= 30) { this.temperature = newTemp; } } togglePower() { this.isOn = !this.isOn; if (!this.isOn) { this.temperature = null; } } }",

If the air conditioner is initially off and a setTemperature(20) method call is made, will the temperature change?
Explanation: Because the air conditioner is off, the condition `this.isOn` evaluates to false. Thus, the method setTemperature does not change the temperature due to the failed condition check.
